title: Why is the question mark curved? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is an old theory that the question mark evolved from the latin "quaestio" for question.  The theory goes that early scribes would place "quaestio" after a sentence to denote it was a question, then shortened it to "qo", then wrote the q over the o, and it evolved into a question mark :  While an interesting theory there's no good evidence for it - there are no known scripts that employ the "q over o" technique. Another account states that the earliest version of a question mark was a dot followed by a "lightning" mark, that would look similar to a dot followed by a tilde.  There are known examples of its usage :  It's easy to imagine how this "dot tilde" punctuation could have morphed into the familiar question mark that we use today.
